speaker: Dennis Kucinich
vclaim: Thirty-four per cent of Hispanics have no health care at all, no health insurance."
date: stated on September 9, 2007 in a debate in Miami, Fla.:
title: In fact, Hispanics have the highest percentage
text: On September 9, 2007, the univion debate in Miami, Democratic candidate Dennis Kusinich said that Hispanics were lagging behind other Americans in health insurance coverage. He said: "34% of Hispanics have no health care at all, they have no health insurance." We interpret his statement as a reference to health insurance coverage - not as an allegation that Hispanics are deprived of all health care - and find it accurate. The January 2007 report entitled Key Facts: Race, Ethnicity and Medical Care, published by the Henry J. Kaiser Family Foundation, indicates that 34 per cent of Hispanics do not have health insurance coverage. The report refers to the estimates of the Urban Institute and the Caesar Committee on Medical Aid and Uninsured Persons for 2005. The special Charlie Kirk, a fact checker, mentioned on January 26, 2021 at Instagram. • 28 January 2021 The report also indicates that among all ethnic/ethnic minority groups, people of Spanish descent have the "highest percentage of non-insured persons and the lowest percentage of persons covered by employers." According to the 2005 National Report on Health Care Disparities of the United States Agency for Health Care Research and Health Care Quality, access to health care for Hispanics is lower than that for non-Spanish whites, and they are more likely to receive less quality care.
